intro: Bulbilis dactyloides, commonly known as prickly pear cactus, is a member of the Cactaceae family and is native to the Americas. It is characterized by its spiny, paddle-shaped stems that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. The plant produces yellow or orange flowers, followed by edible fruits known as tunas. It also has the ability to reproduce through a process called vegetative propagation, where new plants grow from offsets or bulbils. Its unique adaptations make it well-suited for desert and semi-arid climates.
